On [[8 December]] [[1956]], [[J.R.R. Tolkien]] wrote '''[[Letters not published in The Letters of J.R.R. Tolkien|a letter]] to Anthony Roberts'''.<ref name=TS>{{webcite|author=|articleurl=http://www.facebook.com/groups/TheTolkienSociety.EducationalCharity/permalink/10157827761341068/|articlename=Tolkien Society Facebook group discussion|dated=1 April 2020|website=FB|accessed=8 April 2020}}</ref>

*'''Contents:''' Replying to a fan, Tolkien explains why the publication of the "''legends of the [[First Age|First]] and [[Second Age|Second]] Ages, including those related to the [[Silmarils]] ('[[The Silmarillion]]')''" is delayed: "''...unfortunately I am still a busy official and a 'professor' with a considerable amount of other things on hand ... I am afraid there are no [[hobbits]] in these stories, and not much of every-day reality, and that makes me doubtful about their reception.''"<ref name=TS/>
*'''Description:''' One-page, handwritten letter.<ref name=TS/>
